2020-02-25 10:05:26+00:00	Crypto market sees extensive bloodbath as Bitcoin reaches key level	['Cole Petersen'
column2: 'Chainwire'
column3: 'News Desk'
column4: 'Samuel Wan'
column7: 'Ali Martinez']	"After a futile attempt to kick off another uptrend yesterday
column8: the crypto market has seen an intense selloff that has stemmed from Bitcoin’s move down to $9
column10: which has subsequently led most major altcoins to plummet lower.

column1: This bloodbath has led most major cryptocurrencies to form an incredibly close correlation to Bitcoin
column2: and it is highly probable that where the aggregated market heads next will be dependent on whether or not BTC is able to hold above a key level that it is currently trading at.

column1: If the benchmark crypto breaks below this level
column2: it could spark a market-wide selloff that leads many major altcoins to invalidate the bullish market structures they have formed over the past several weeks.

column1: Crypto market sees intense selloff following Bitcoin’s bearish rejection
Yesterday
column2: Bitcoin attempted to make a move up to $10
column3: 000 that was met with significant selling pressure
column4: subsequently leading BTC to plummet towards $9

column1: This rejection sent shockwaves throughout the aggregated crypto market
column2: with many altcoins that were previously expressing bullishness to see notable selloffs.

column1: At the time of writing
column2: Tezos and Chainlink – two of the best performing altcoins in 2020–are leading today’s drop
column3: trading down 8 percent and 7.5 percent respectively.

column1: Most other altcoins are closely trailing these losses
column2: with Litecoin
column3: EOS
column4: Bitcoin Cash
column5: and others all trading down roughly 6 percent.

column1: The only major cryptocurrency that has been able to dodge losses of this magnitude is Ethereum
column2: which is trading down just under 3 percent.

column1: Where altcoins go next depends on how Bitcoin reacts to one key level
Today’s selloff has led Bitcoin to a key support level at $9
column2: 550 that bulls are currently attempting to defend
column3: and a drop below this level could open the gates for significantly further near-term losses.

column1: Big Chonis
column2: a prominent cryptocurrency analyst
column3: spoke about this key level in a recent tweet
column4: referencing the level seen on the below chart.

column1: “Very important area that Bitcoin bulls want to hold…Has acted as support to resistance and back to support… weekly!”
In the near-term
column2: how deep the ongoing altcoin selloff extends will likely rest largely on whether BTC is able to further extend its upwards momentum
column3: as a failure to do so will likely lead investors to flee their altcoin positions in favor of BTC."

column1: 2020-02-22 10:35:25+00:00	Can the Total Crypto Market Cap Hit $10 trillion by 2023?	[]	"Popular YouTube crypto analyst
column2: Benjamin Cowen
column3: has been considering the logarithmic regression band for the total cryptocurrency market cap in his latest video
column4: and based on his analysis
column5: thinks that the total digital asset market cap could hit $10 trillion during the next bull run.

column1: What’s A Logarithmic Regression Band?
While it may sound like AI-generated musicians for psychotherapists to relax to
column2: the logarithmic regression band is actually the range of values to which the crypto market tends to fall back when it is not in a bubble. It is represented by the green band on the chart below.

column1: The line forms a smooth curve overtime when plotted against a logarithmic value scale. At the peak of the 2017-2018 bubble/burst cycle
column2: the total crypto market cap came very close to $1 trillion. However
column3: it has since fallen back to the regression band and currently stands at around $290 billion.

column1: Diminishing Returns Each Crypto Market Cycle

Plotting the difference between the total market cap and the lowest point of the regression band over time shows that the peak levels are becoming lower with each market cycle. This supports the theory of diminishing returns over time.
Assuming this behavior continues
column2: we can project a potential peak level above the regression band for the next major bull run. As an example
column3: Cowen projects this happening in 2022
column4: but of course
column5: it could be earlier or later than this

column1: The potential outcome of this would be a total cryptocurrency market cap of around $10 trillion at the peak of the next bubble. In this scenario market cap is likely to oscillate within the regression band for a while before starting its climb.
But What About $100 Trillion Bitcoin?
Ah yes
column2: according to PlanB’s stock to flow (S2F) model
column3: the Bitcoin market cap alone is projected to go to $100 trillion. Cowen’s $10 Trillion market cap peak for the entire crypto market doesn’t sound so impressive against that prediction.

column1: Of course
column2: the $100 trillion Bitcoin is still some way off in the future. The projected price increases in the S2F model happen because of the artificial limiting of supply over time. The next halving will happen in May this year.

column1: However
column2: the $100 trillion projection isn’t due until another two halvings after that
column3: or sometime in 2028. So
column4: for now
column5: a $10 trillion market cap by 2022 will have to do.

column1: At current Bitcoin dominance levels
column2: a $10 trillion total crypto market cap gives a BTC price of around $330
column4: so that’s something to look forward to.

column1: Do you think the total crypto market cap will hit a $10 trillion valuation in 2023? Share your thoughts in the comments below!
Images via Shutterstock
column2: YouTube: Benjamin Cowen"

column1: 2020-02-20 14:03:27+00:00	Top Analyst: Foul Play Pumped the Crypto Market by $66 Billion	"['Yashu Gola Is A Mumbai-Based Finance Journalist. He Is Profoundly Active In The Bitcoin Space Since'
column2: 'Has Contributed To Several Cryptocurrency Media Outlets'
column3: 'Including Newsbtc'
column4: 'Fxdailyreport'
column7: ""Yashu Holds A Bachelor'S In Information Technology""
column10: ""Programming Language. He Has Also Won The 'Atulya Award' For His Efforts Towards Raising""]"	"Jacob Canfield
column11: a crypto market analyst known for accurately predicting bitcoin’s 2020 price rally
column12: has alleged that there was market manipulation in the trading of altcoins this year.

column1: In a video published last week
column2: Mr. Canfield linked the resurgence of otherwise underperforming cryptocurrencies like Ethereum and EOS to PlusToken
column3: a Ponzi scheme that
column4: under the disguise of a high yield investment company
column5: stole over $3 billion from its clients. The steal included 70

column1: Mr. Canfield noted that PlusToken scammers first artificially pumped bitcoin from $3
column2: 500 to circa $14
column3: 000 last year. They then sold about 70-90K BTC in the range of $9
column6: which roughly equals about $600 million. The profitable move gave them enough capital to drive the altcoin market upward.

column1: “If [Plustoken scammers] are using their capital to push the Ethereum market
column2: then they can push its prices back to $300
column4: $600 and even $1
column6: ” said Mr. Canfield. “They can also set up traps for short-sellers and continue to push the short-seller cascade in thin-order markets.”

column1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EpiUaytYuFo
The statements came at the time when altcoins are severely outperforming their top rival bitcoin. Ethereum and EOS
column2: for instance
column3: surged by up to 130 and 155 percent after bottoming out in December 2019. In the same timeframe
column4: bitcoin surged by up to 63 percent only.

column1: On the whole
column2: the crypto market – excluding bitcoin – attracted up to circa $66 billion between December 2019 until February 2020 top.

column1: Mr. Canfield theorized that PlusToken scammers are using cryptocurrency exchanges and OTC brokers with closed order-books to trade their steal for alternative crypto tokens. The analyst further admitted that he has stopped entering short leveraged positions over his fears of fat price dumps.
Crypto Trend Will Continue
Despite fears of a massive dump
column2: Mr. Canfield believed the crypto market will keep rising. The analyst recommended traders to identify near-term dips to buy Ethereum
column3: EOS or other altcoins but exit their positions on the first signs of deep pullbacks.

column1: He further advised traders to watch the crypto wallets that belong to the scammers associated with PlusToken
column2: noting that any kind of small or big withdrawal would alert them of a potential bearish correction."

column1: 2020-02-10 16:15:36+00:00	Bitcoin Whale Gives Warning About Inflated Market	[]	"One of the leading traders on Bitfinex and a notable Bitcoin whale has given a warning about the impact of ‘phantom money’ on the market.
How much of cryptocurrency trading is real? By some estimates
column2: only a small fraction of the entire market. A bombshell report in March 2019 found that around 95% of the entire market is fake
column3: as BeInCrypto has previously reported. Since then
column4: exchanges and various exchange data sites have put in stricter reporting standards with metrics like ‘real liquidity.’

column1: Despite these changes
column2: however
column3: one whale claims that the market is still incredibly ‘inflated.’ Joe007 (@J0E007) is a prominent Bitcoin whale in the cryptocurrency world. Often known for topping Bitfinex leaderboards
column4: he’s also been outspoken on rumors in the industry—and often doesn’t hold back criticism.

column1: Sponsored Sponsored
As Bitcoin breaks the $10
column2: 000 price point and the entire market rallies
column3: Joe007 criticized the amount of so-called “phantom money” in the market. He writes: “At some point
column4: people would want to cash out their mad gainz only to find no one on the other side of the market. That would be the show.”

column1: You can push the price only so long with fantom money. At some point
column2: people would want to cash out their mad gainz only to find no one on the other side of the market. That would be the show. — Joe007 signals·alerts·funds are scams
column3: all of them (@J0E007) February 9

column1: Sponsored Sponsored
However
column2: recent metrics seem to contradict Joe007’s claim about this rally being based on the so-called ‘phantom money.’ On-chain investor activity has increased significantly parallel to this rally
column3: as also reported by BeInCrypto. This didn’t happen when Bitcoin broke $10
column4: 000 in the summer of 2019
column5: so there’s no reason to believe that this rally is less legitimate than others.

column1: Joe007 is known for stirring the pot on Twitter and causing controversy. For example
column2: last month Joe007 claimed that Binance was outright faking their numbers. He’s also taken issue with Huobi and OKEx faking their reported trading stats as well. A known critic of Bitcoin SV (BSV)
column3: Joe007 has also said that BSV delistings may have helped the coin ‘scam pump’ much easier due to low liquidity.

column1: Sponsored Sponsored
Whether or not Joe007 is correct about the cryptocurrency market’s current rally remains to be seen. As of now
column2: Bitcoin has dropped down under the $10
column3: 000 price point and is currently trading at around $9
